title: PHPExceptiongetTrace() Method

metadata.description: Learn about PHPExceptiongetTrace() Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Output the stack trace:
<?php
function myFunction($num) {
throw new Exception("An error 
  occurred");
}
try {
myFunction(5);
} catch (Exception 
  $e) {
print_r($e->getTrace());
}
?>

Definition and Usage
The
getTrace()
method returns a stack trace in the form of an array.
Stack traces contain information about all of the functions that are running at a given
moment. The stack trace provided by this method has information about the stack at the
time that the exception was thrown.
Syntax
$exception->getTrace()
Technical Details
Return Value:
Returns a stack trace in the form of an array
Related Pages
Read more about Exceptions in our
PHP Exceptions Chapter
.
PHP Reference: The
getTraceAsString()
Method.

★
+1

quiz.question: What is Stack traces contain information about all of the functions that?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of Stack traces contain information about all of the functions that is 'running at a given
moment'.

summary: This tutorial covers PHPExceptiongetTrace() Method concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPExceptiongetTrace() Method effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPExceptiongetTrace() Method and how to apply it in your projects.
